column4: I am running ubuntu, I just installed "wine" i need to find the ~/.wine/drive_c/ folder,  where would this folder directory be located?
it's a hidden directory located in your home directory. but if you have never ran wine, you might need to start winecfg first to generate that directory
I have ran wine, Can you please tell me where that "hidden" directory would be?
press ctrl+h in nautilus

Cratel2: No I didnt, Todays my first day on linux, Maybe I didn't run WINE than? But i have installed something with it and it supposedly made a Drive C:\, Any other idea's on where this could be located?
you should run winecfg first, which will create that directory (and open a config window, which you can close then)
Thank you, I Think im catching on now!
You're welcome
Even after that, Still no Wine folder in my Home Directory?
have you enabled View hidden folders in your file manager?
Prob. Not, How Do I go about doing that?
press Ctrl+H in the file manager, or go to view>show hidden files
Wow, I'm a moron. Thanks man!
y/w
I'm trying to install Microsoft fonts, I installed them, but now I need to put them in my "C:\Windows\Fonts" from wine, Any idea on how I can recover where these files were installed?
or go to fonts:/// in your file manager to view the installed fonts in linux, then you can copy them to .wine/drive_c/windows/fonts
Where is my File Manger, Im so new to this!
where you found the .wine directory
There is no filemanager or fonts:/// in there.
or you can press Alt+F2, type fonts:/// and press enter
or press Ctrl+L in the file manager
You are the man!!!
